title: All eyes on India as Brics takes up US tariffs, Israel
content: The Brics summit in Rio is set to address global concerns, with the declaration expected to reflect India's stance on terrorism while urging a stronger position on US tariffs and Israel's actions in Gaza. Negotiations are ongoing, with proposals including condemnation of US tariffs and concerns about the situation in Palestinian territory, potentially posing challenges for India's diplomatic balancing act.

title: Musk launches ‘America Party’: Can he run for president in 2028?
content: Elon Musk has unveiled his 'America Party,' challenging the existing two-party system amidst a strained relationship with Donald Trump. Despite constitutional ineligibility for the presidency due to his African birth, Musk aims to disrupt the political landscape. A recent poll on X revealed strong public support for a new party, prompting Musk to action.

title: Himachal monsoon havoc: 74 dead; IMD issues red alert
content: Torrential monsoon rains have caused widespread devastation in Himachal Pradesh, resulting in 74 deaths and leaving dozens missing. Rescue operations are underway in the Mandi district, the worst-hit area, where teams are struggling with challenging terrain to locate those trapped. A red alert has been issued for more heavy rainfall, exacerbating the already dire situation.

title: 10-hour workdays allowed in Telangana: Overtime pay for anything beyond 48 hours/week
content: The Telangana government has approved increasing working hours for commercial establishments to 10 hours daily, while maintaining the 48-hour weekly limit. Employees working beyond this limit are entitled to overtime wages. The new rule, effective upon gazette publication on July 8, aims to promote ease of doing business, with potential extensions considered for factories.

title: 'If he gets …': Shastri makes bold prediction as Suryavanshi slams fastest ton
content: Ravi Shastri has lauded 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, hinting at a possible fast-track to the Indian national team after his record-breaking 143 against England U-19. Suryavanshi's explosive innings, including the fastest Youth ODI century, has cemented his status as a generational talent. His prior IPL exploits further highlight his potential for rapid advancement in cricket.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years; founding country manager says: This is more than a...
content: After 25 years, Microsoft is reportedly exiting Pakistan, a move confirmed by the founding head of Microsoft Pakistan, Jawwad Rehman, via a LinkedIn post. The company commenced operations in June 2000 but has gradually reduced its presence.

title: Patna business tycoon's killing linked to jailed criminals? Beur Central Jail raided
content: Patna businessman Gopal Khemka's murder has sparked a major police investigation, including a raid at Beur Central Jail, due to possible links with inmates. This incident echoes the 2018 killing of his son, raising suspicions of organized crime involvement. Khemka, a prominent industrialist, was shot dead near his residence.

title: Wimbledon: Djokovic’s daughter steals spotlight with adorable dance | Watch
content: Novak Djokovic celebrated his 100th Wimbledon singles win on Centre Court, but his daughter, Tara, stole the show. During an on-court interview, Djokovic explained a dance he's been doing is to the song "Pump It Up." He then encouraged Tara to demonstrate, and she happily obliged, pumping her fists to the delight of the crowd.

title: Indians kidnapped in Mali: What are the demands of Al-Qaeda?
content: An Al-Qaeda-linked group in Mali has abducted three Indian nationals, including P Venkataraman from Odisha, and is reportedly demanding ransom for their release. The abduction occurred during an attack on the Diamond Cement Factory, prompting concern from the Ministry of External Affairs. Indian embassy is working closely with Malian authorities to secure the safe return of the abducted workers.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees; ‘We must work….’
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: Dalai Lama turns 90: PM Modi calls him symbol of love, compassion and patience
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended birthday wishes to the Dalai Lama on his 90th birthday, lauding him as a symbol of love, compassion, patience, and moral discipline. Special prayers were held by Tibetan Buddhist monks in exile at the Dorjidak Monastery near Shimla. Several leaders attended celebrations in Dharamshala to honor the spiritual leader.

title: Panic at Spain Airport: Ryanair passengers leap from wing after fire alert
content: A Ryanair flight at Palma Airport in Majorca experienced a false fire alarm, leading to a chaotic emergency evacuation. Passengers, in a state of panic, resorted to jumping from the aircraft's wing, resulting in 18 minor injuries. Six individuals were hospitalized, while Ryanair arranged a replacement aircraft and apologized for the disruption.

title: ICAI CA may 2025 toppers: Rajan Kabra clinches AIR 1 in Finals; full list of top scorers
content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India has declared the CA May 2025 results. Rajan Kabra secured All India Rank 1 in the CA Final exam. Disha Ashish Gokhru topped the Intermediate level. Vrinda Agarwal achieved AIR 1 in the Foundation exam. The results reflect the difficulty of the CA course.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: AI helps couple conceive after 18 years of struggle
content: After two decades of unsuccessful attempts, a couple conceived using the STAR system, an AI-based fertility breakthrough developed at Columbia University Fertility Center. This innovative technology identifies viable sperm in men with azoospermia, a condition causing complete infertility.

title: ‘Kisi tarah se bachalo’: Civil services aspirant, lab technician found dead in Delhi fire
content: A devastating fire at a Vishal Mega Mart in Delhi's Karol Bagh claimed the lives of two individuals: a civil services aspirant and a lab technician. The building lacked a fire safety certificate, leading to a police investigation into negligence. One victim was found trapped in an elevator, desperately pleading for help in a text message to his brother.

title: In zest or jest? Will live for 130 years, perhaps more, Dalai Lama tells followers
content: A day before his 90th birthday, the Dalai Lama expressed his hope to live beyond 130 years. Addressing devotees in McLeodganj, he stated his belief in having served Buddha Dharma and the Tibetan people well. While previously suggesting he might live to 110 or 113, the spiritual leader's latest statement comes amid ongoing discussions about succession.

title: 'To give you back your freedom': Musk launches new political party - 'The America Party'
content: Elon Musk has officially declared the establishment of the America Party in the United States, responding to a poll conducted on his social media platform X, where a majority voted in favor of a new political entity. Musk stated the party aims to restore freedom and address governmental waste, criticizing the existing two-party system.

title: Brazil visit: PM Modi welcomed with Op Sindoor-themed cultural performance
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome from the Indian community in Brazil, highlighted by a cultural dance inspired by Operation Sindoor. The performance, featuring the song "Saugandh Mujhe Iss Mitti Ki," drew praise from the Prime Minister. Modi is in Brazil for the 17th BRICS Summit and a State Visit, aiming to strengthen the India-Brazil Strategic Partnership.

title: Pune techie rape case: Woman continuously changed her statements, say cops
content: In Pune, a 22-year-old data scientist's statement was recorded by the Chief Judicial Magistrate regarding her rape complaint against a delivery agent. Police took this step due to inconsistencies in her statements during questioning.

title: Chess | 'Shocking' - Magnus Carlsen takes another swipe at Gukesh
content: After a stellar performance in the Rapid event, Dommaraju Gukesh experienced a significant setback on the first day of the Blitz competition at the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Chess Tournament in Zagreb. He only managed 1.5 points, losing seven games. Magnus Carlsen surged ahead, leading the standings, while R Praggnanandhaa had a mixed day, slipping to fifth overall.

title: ICAI CA result may 2025 announced for foundation, intermediate & final; direct link here
content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has announced the CA May 2025 exam results for Foundation, Intermediate, and Final levels on July 6. Students can access their scorecards on the official ICAI websites, which include subject-wise marks and pass/fail status. Qualifying candidates advance to the next stage, while others can apply for revaluation or re-appear.

title: Argentina visit: PM Modi receives 'key to city of Buenos Aires'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was conferred the Key to the City of Buenos Aires during his historic Argentina visit, the first bilateral trip by an Indian PM in 57 years. He held wide-ranging talks with President Javier Milei on boosting ties in trade, defence, and energy. Argentina was the third stop in his five-nation tour.

title: Meerut shocker: Man films cancer patient’s daughter bathing at govt hospital
content: In Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, a man got arrested for filming a woman bathing at a government hospital. The woman was attending to her cancer-stricken mother. The accused, from Muzaffarnagar, was there for his wife's tuberculosis treatment. He filmed the woman and then blackmailed her. This incident occurred after a rape case in the same hospital.

title: IND vs ENG: Historic Test Heroics! All the records Shubman Gill set at Edgbaston
content: Shubman Gill dominated the Edgbaston Test with exceptional batting, setting numerous records, including the highest score by an Indian captain. His twin centuries powered India to a commanding position and placed him in an elite club of players with centuries in both innings. Gill's performance defined the match, etching his name in cricket history.

title: Google Maps misguides, car drives into stream; 5 from Nagpur rescued unhurt
content: Five individuals from Nagpur, en route to Tirupati, experienced an unexpected detour when their reliance on Google Maps led them into a stream near Gangupahad village in Jangaon. Driver Sravan, following the app's directions, failed to notice the water body. Fortunately, local villagers witnessed the incident and promptly rescued the group, ensuring everyone escaped unharmed.

title: Delhi tragedy: 3 AC mechanics found dead in room; gas leak suspected
content: In Dakshinpuri, New Delhi, three AC mechanics were found dead in their poorly ventilated room, which also served as their workplace. Police suspect a gas leak from AC compressor cylinders caused suffocation. A colleague is critically ill. The small room lacked ventilation, and gas cylinders were stored inside, possibly leading to the tragedy during the night.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Outbatted and outbowled England' - India deserve to win
content: Former England cricketers Nasser Hussain and Stuart Broad believe India deserves victory at Edgbaston, citing their dominance with both bat and ball throughout the Test. Hussain highlighted India's winning of more sessions and Akash Deep's impressive spell. Broad acknowledged India's superior bowling and batting performance, admitting his surprise at their strong recovery after the Headingley defeat.

title: IND v ENG: Yashasvi Jaiswal fulfils wish of blind fan with sweet gesture | Watch
content: Young Ravi, a visually impaired cricket enthusiast, fulfilled his dream of meeting Indian opener Yashasvi Jaiswal at Edgbaston. Jaiswal, touched by Ravi's passion, gifted him his match bat as a memorable keepsake. Ravi also met England's Joe Root, receiving a signed jersey and gloves, making it an unforgettable day filled with joy and admiration for the sport.

title: 'More than technique ...': DK hails Gill as he steps into the legacy of Sachin, Virat
content: India captain Shubman Gill etched his name in Test cricket history at Edgbaston, becoming the first player to score 250 and 150+ in the same match. His aggregate of 430 runs nears Graham Gooch's record. Dinesh Karthik likened Gill's rise to Tendulkar and Kohli, praising his captaincy and improved technique.

title: Chess | 'I feel pity' - Garry Kasparov asserts Gukesh not ready for Blitz
content: Garry Kasparov believes Gukesh's rapid win against Magnus Carlsen had a significant psychological impact, affecting his blitz performance at the SuperUnited Rapid & Blitz tournament. Kasparov observed Gukesh's games were feeble in the blitz section, suggesting he might not be ready for the faster format. Carlsen, however, recovered strongly in the blitz after a poor rapid showing.

title: 'AICC tried to revive AJL': Rahul's counsel in Herald case; slams ED's 'crude lies'
content: Senior advocate R S Cheema, representing Rahul Gandhi, told a Delhi court that the AICC was trying to save Associated Journals Limited (AJL), publisher of National Herald, not sell its assets. He refuted ED's money laundering allegations, claiming they were "crude lies." Cheema argued AICC aimed to revive a freedom movement institution, not seek profit.

title: Texas flash floods: Death toll rises to 50; rescue ops under way
content: Tragedy struck Texas Hill Country due to severe flooding. At least 50 people died in the disaster. Kerr County is the worst affected area. Dozens of girls are missing, including some from a summer camp. Rescue operations are underway with state and federal assistance. Governor Greg Abbott declared a state of disaster.

title: When Rakhee Majumdar ended marriage with Gulzar over his concern for Suchitra Sen
content: Veteran actress Rakhee Majumdar’s marriage to lyricist Sampooran Singh Kalra, popularly known as Gulzar, became an emotional topic for her fans when their bond ended on a traumatic note. However, after parting ways unofficially, they grew closer to each other.

title: Historic First! India join fabled 1000-club, smash record for most runs in 1st two matches
content: Led by captain Shubman Gill Team India etched their name in Test cricket history at Edgbaston on Saturday, becoming the first Indian side to amass over 1,000 runs in a single match against England. This feat, only the sixth of its kind, saw India reach 1,014 runs, surpassing their previous best.

title: ‘We were made villain’: Pirate Software says backlash gave petition a boost
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: 'Until we got married': Kansas city chiefs star Patrick Mahomes opens on how Brittany supported him
content: Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback Patrick Mahomes recently lauded his wife, Brittany, for her unwavering support since their high school days. He credited her for helping him evolve, both on and off the field. Mahomes highlighted Brittany's constant presence and influence, acknowledging her pivotal role in his personal and professional growth.

title: Knicks eye $113 million Bucks superstar; potential trio with KAT could boost title hopes
content: Damian Lillard's unexpected departure from the Milwaukee Bucks has opened doors, with the New York Knicks surprisingly emerging as a potential suitor. Recovering from an Achilles rupture, Lillard could benefit from the Knicks' renowned medical team. While a Lillard-Brunson backcourt presents defensive challenges, the opportunity to acquire a top player at a reduced cost is tempting.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs' European vacation with a cryptic 3-word message that fans can’t ignore
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: Bubbles in urine: What it could mean, according to a doctor
content: Persistent foamy urine can be a sign of underlying health issues, but occasional bubbles are usually harmless and resolved with hydration. Dr. Shirley Koeh advises that if bubbles persist despite increased water intake and frequent urination, it's crucial to test for protein in the urine, potentially indicating hypertension, diabetes, or kidney disease.

title: LeBron James & Drake’s friendship hits breaking point after Kendrick Lamar concert drama
content: LeBron James and Drake, once close friends, are seemingly embroiled in a public feud. The tension escalated when James was spotted enjoying Kendrick Lamar's diss track aimed at Drake. Subsequently, James posted cryptic lyrics on Instagram, and Drake responded with pointed verses in his new song, fueling speculation about a rift between the two superstars.

title: Savannah James shares glimpses from her daughter Zhuri's lavish bedroom
content: Savannah James shared a glimpse into her daughter Zhuri's lavishly decorated room on Instagram, humorously revealing that Zhuri never actually sleeps there. The video captured Zhuri's playful bedtime routine, which included climbing on her bed's wooden structure, prompting a lighthearted exchange with her mother. Amidst family changes, Savannah balances her roles, prioritizing family life and advocating for self-care.

title: Lakhs in Bihar may lose vote, ADR tells SC
content: The Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) has challenged the Election Commission's special intensive revision (SIR) of Bihar's electoral rolls in the Supreme Court, arguing it could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly from marginalized communities. ADR contends the SIR's documentation requirements disproportionately affect vulnerable populations, as Aadhaar and ration cards are not accepted.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par': Aamir Khan starrer soars on third Saturday; mints over Rs 140 cr
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' a spiritual sequel to 'Taare Zameen Par,' has grossed over Rs 140 crore in India after 16 days. Despite a slight dip in collections mid-week, the film rebounded strongly on its third Saturday, earning Rs 4.75 crore.

title: Army doctor helps woman deliver baby at station using pocket knife, hair clips
content: While awaiting his train at Jhansi railway station, Major Rohit Bachwala, an army doctor, swiftly aided a pregnant woman in labor using a pocket knife, hair clips, and a dhoti. Railway staff secured the area and provided gloves.

title: 93% of Bihar voters given enumeration forms, 13.2% have submitted them: EC
content: Bihar's electoral roll revision progresses swiftly, with 93.7% of voters receiving enumeration forms and 13.2% already submitting them. The Election Commission allows electors to supplement incomplete documentation until July 25. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar anticipates timely completion with full transparency.

title: 'America Party is formed': Musk targets House, Senate seats; aims to sway narrow Congressional votes
content: Elon Musk has announced the formation of the "America Party," aiming to challenge the existing two-party system. This decision follows his strong opposition to a recently signed tax-cut and spending bill. Musk plans to target a few key House and Senate seats, hoping to gain enough influence to sway critical legislative outcomes, capitalizing on the narrow margins in Congress.

title: Former White Sox pitcher, world champ Jenks dies
content: Bobby Jenks, 44, a former pitcher for the Chicago White Sox who was on the roster when the club won the 2005 World Series, died Friday in Sintra, Portugal, the team announced, months after being diagnosed with adenocarcinoma, a form of stomach cancer.

title: Volpe toss hits Judge as sloppy Yanks fall again
content: Anthony Volpe accidently hit Judge in the face with a toss, one of many mistakes the Yankees made in their 12-6 loss to the Mets for their sixth straight defeat.

title: Bailey shaky in debut, but hustle impresses Jazz
content: Jazz rookie Ace Bailey finished with just eight points in his Salt Lake City Summer League debut, but willingness to defend and rebound impressed his coaches.

title: Irish land WR Fitzgerald, son of ex-NFL star Larry
content: Devin Fitzgerald, a three-star wide receiver and the son of former NFL star Larry Fitzgerald, has committed to Notre Dame.

title: Rockets trade Whitmore to Wizards, sources say
content: The Houston Rockets are trading Cam Whitmore to the Washington Wizards for two second-round picks, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Grizzlies trading center Huff to Pacers
content: The Memphis Grizzlies are trading center Jay Huff to the Indiana Pacers for one second-round pick and one second-round pick swap, sources told ESPN.

title: Collier denies Unrivaled, WNBA conflict of interest
content: Napheesa Collier pushed back on the idea that she has a conflict of interest as co-founder of Unrivaled and vice president of the WNBPA.

title: Russell, No. 4 WR in 2026, commits to Syracuse
content: Calvin Russell, a four-star receiver ranked No. 28 in the ESPN 300, would be the highest-ranked addition in Syracuse history if he signs later this year.

title: 🏆 USA vs. Mexico: Gold Cup final preview
content: Sunday's Gold Cup final is a reunion for the Concacaf rivals U.S. and Mexico, but who has the edge heading into the festivities at Houston's NRG Stadium? Here's what you need to know.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Gonzalo García proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo García could be the reason they go all the way.

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: PSG passed one of their most difficult tests of the Club World Cup, overcoming two red cards in 2-0 win over Bayern Munich.

title: Dortmund coach: MetLife field more suited to golf
content: In the eyes of Borussia Dortmund coach Niko Kovač, the MetLife Stadium field was better suited for a round of golf than a match at the Club World Cup.

title: Müller bids Bayern farewell in loss; future unclear
content: Thomas Müller played his last game for Bayern Munich in a loss to PSG in the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup on Saturday.

title: Mbappé stunner sets up Madrid semi with PSG
content: Real Madrid edged Borussia Dortmund 3-2 in a dramatic Club World Cup quarterfinal Saturday to set up a semifinal against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Poch: U.S. needs 'pressure' of final before '26 WC
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said his team needs the "pressure" Sunday's Gold Cup final against Mexico to prepare for next summer's World Cup.

title: Holders England beaten by France in Euros opener
content: Marie-Antoinette Katoto and Sandy Baltimore scored first-half goals as France beat reigning champions England 2-1 in their Women's Euro Group D opener

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Jota funeral: Liverpool squad, family pay respects
content: Family, friends and teammates gathered to pay their respects to Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, whose funerals were held Saturday morning.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: The art of a team talk: Why great captains, coaches use them to teach, not scream
content: From impassioned shouting to calm instructions, team captains and managers attempt to motivate their players by any means necessary. But which messages actually work?

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Wales fans light up Lucerne on tournament debut
content: Wales fans celebrated as they made their tournament debut, but they were no match for Netherlands. Here's what you need to know from Saturday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Leão
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Leão from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: if any of these thoughts come true, don't be surprised . if a fantasy season comes true, it's a legitimately valuable fantasy season for sure . it was his first game back in the lineup, his first time playing since the first week of the season.

title: 'He's trying to get perfection out of me': Jets pushing Sauce Gardner for more
content: the new york Jets ' expectations for Sauce Gardner are reminiscent of the old "Friday Night Lights" movie . he challenged the star cornerback to raise his game to a new level . "the fact that he's trying to get perfection out of me is what I need," he said .

title: Orioles' lineup gets a boost; Chapman set to return for Giants
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . storms are expected in the area and there could be a delay, though the game will likely play . the Baltimore Orioles lineup received a couple of boosts with Jordan Westburg returning after a five-game absension .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Texans' revamped offense coming together heading into training camp
content: the Texans will have a different pass game, multiple rushing schemes and more running in between the tackles . new coordinator Nick Caley will run the show with the texans this offseason . caley says he's in the discovery process when we get to work with them on the field .

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Defending champ England fall at first hurdle, as France send statement
content: France beat defending champions England 2-1 in their euro 2025 group d opener . Marie-Antoinette Katoto and Sandy Baltimore scored for the hosts . the defeat was chalked off due to a toe offside .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .

title: EA reveals team ratings, changes to CFB 26 Ultimate Team and H2H modes
content: EA Sports releases more details on the competitive aspects of college football 26 . Ultimate Team mode will feature all-new card art in the upcoming iteration . card legibility, too, has been improved . Solo Battles is replaced by Study Hall as the primary single-player mode .

title: Ex Chief Justice Overstaying In Government Home, Top Court Writes To Centre
content: Noting that former Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud has overstayed in the Chief Justice's official residence, the Supreme Court administration has written to the Centre, urging it to ensure that the bungalow is vacated immediately

title: Uddhav Thackeray Reunites With Raj, Says Will Win Mumbai Civic Polls Together
content: Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said he and Raj Thackeray have come together to stay united as the cousins shared a political stage for the first time after two decades on the issue of Marathi identity and "imposition" of the Hindi language.

title: "My Daughter Was Here": Father's Search At Summer Camp After Texas Flood
content: With a drizzle falling on Camp Mystic, the flood-ravaged Christian summer camp on the Guadalupe River in Texas, a father navigated the debris in search of his eight-year-old daughter.

title: Mastermind Of Religious Conversion Gang, Aide Arrested In Uttar Pradesh
content: The Uttar Pradesh Police's Anti-Terrorism Squad has arrested Jalaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, the alleged mastermind of a religious conversion gang along with his aide.

title: 'Deeply Saddened': PM Modi Condoles Loss Of Lives In Devastating Texas Floods
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated that he was deeply saddened to learn about the loss of lives, especially children, in the devastating floods in Texas and offered his condolences to the US government.

title: Elon Musk's Plan To Crush Uniparty Involves Strategy That Defeated Spartans
content: Elon Musk, the world's richest man, is now going solo in politics after a brief stint in the administration of US President Donald Trump, the world's most powerful elected leader.

title: "China Has Nothing To Do With The Institution Of Dalai Lama": Pema Khandu
content: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu emphasised the distinct identity of the Dalai Lama's institution, Gaden Phodrang Trust, saying that "China has nothing to do with the institution."

title: At Least 43 Killed In Texas Flash Floods, Children Missing From Summer Camp
content: At least 43 people have died and dozens of children are missing in the Texas Hill Country after catastrophic flooding, with officials warning the casualty count will climb as forecasts call for more rain and the risk of further flash floods in the co

title: PM Modi Wishes Dalai Lama On 90th Birthday, Prays For His Good Health, Long Life
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday led the nation in extending greetings to Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama on his 90th birthday, with prayers for his continued good health and long life.

title: 2 Farmers, Repairing Punctured Tyre, Die After Being Hit By Speeding Car In Rajasthan
content: Two farmers were killed in Jaisalmer district when a car hit them while they were repairing a punctured tractor tire on Saturday, police said.

title: Dalai Lama Vows To Keep Defying China As He Turns 90
content: The spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhists, the Dalai Lama, turns 90 on Sunday after a week of celebrations by followers during which he riled China again and spoke about his hope to live beyond 130 and reincarnate after dying.

title: "I Am A Simple Buddhist Monk": Dalai Lama's 90th Birthday Message
content: Dalai Lama called to focus on achieving peace of mind through cultivating a good heart and by being compassionate.

title: BRICS Nations Raise 'Serious Concerns' Over Trump Tariffs In Draft Text
content: BRICS leaders meeting in Rio de Janeiro on Sunday are expected to decry US President Donald Trump's "indiscriminate" trade tariffs, saying they are illegal and risk hurting the global economy.

title: Iran's Khamenei Makes First Appearance Days After US Strikes On Nuke Sites
content: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday made his first public appearance since the outbreak of his country's recent 12-day war with Israel, taking part in a religious ceremony in Tehran, state media reported.

title: "I Ended Up Overreacting": Businessman's Apology After Office Vandalised
content: Raj Thackeray-led party Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers vandalised businessman Sushil Kedia's office in Mumbai on Friday, days after he vowed not to learn Marathi.

title: Elon Musk Launches 'America Party' "To Give You Back Your Freedom"
content: Elon Musk, an ex-ally of US President Donald Trump, said Saturday he had launched a new political party in the United States to challenge what the tech billionaire described as the country's "one-party system."

title: Traditional Dances, Folk Songs: PM Modi Receives Grand Welcome In Brazil
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a grand welcome from the Indian community upon his arrival in Rio de Janeiro for a four-day visit to Brazil during which he will participate in the 17th BRICS Summit and undertake a state visit.

title: PM Modi Honoured With 'Key To The City Of Buenos Aires' During Argentina Visit
content: PM Narendra Modi was felicitated with the 'Key to the City of Buenos Aires', a symbolic ceremonial honour, during his official two-day state visit in Argentina, recognising his contribution in strengthening the ties between the two nations.

title: Amid Uproar, Poll Body's Big Decision On Documents For Bihar Roll Revision
content: In a major decision following an uproar by opposition parties, the Election Commission has said voters can get verified in the electoral rolls as part of the Special Intensive Revision in Bihar even without submitting the mandatory documents.

title: Reuters' X Account In India Withheld "In Response To Legal Demand"
content: The official X handle of the international news agency Reuters has been withheld in India due to a "legal demand".

title: Madras High Court suo motu impleads Mata Amritanandamayi Math in forest case
content: It relates to alleged erection of a two-kilometre-long electric fence disturbing movement of elephants on Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham campus in Ettimadai

title: Two militants arrested, explosives recovered in Manipur
content: Intelligence-based search operations and cordons are being widely carried out to apprehend those involved in extortion and criminal activities in the State

title: BJP, Nitish Kumar made Bihar crime capital of India: Rahul Gandhi on Khemka killing
content: Rahul Gandhi also asserted that in the upcoming Assembly polls, the vote will not be just to change the government, but to save the State.

title: News in Frames | Kolhapuri chappals walk on chic runways
content: Rooted in centuries-old craftsmanship, these eco-friendly, handmade sandals stand as a proud symbol of India’s artisanal heritage and sustainable fashion

title: Hundreds of red-robed monks and nuns braved incessant rain as Dalai Lama describes himself as a ‘simple Buddhist monk’
content: Hundreds of red-robed monks and nuns braved incessant rain and poured through the narrow streets of Dharamshala to make their way towards the main Dalai Lama temple

title: Dalai Lama turns 90 after week of celebrations and vows to keep defying China for years
content: The Nobel laureate is regarded as one of the world's most influential religious leaders, with a following that extends well beyond Buddhism

title: Hizbul supremo among 11 chargesheeted in cross-border narco-terror case by J&K State Investigation Agency
content: The others were identified as Khalid Hussain of Rajouri, Mohd Shokit of Poonch, Javid Ahmed Rather of Budgam, Manzoor Ahmad and Asif Rehman Reshi of Srinagar and Harpreet Singh, Chain Singh, Sahil Kumar, and Sandeepak Singh of Jammu, the official said.

title: Kolkata gangrape: Accused Monojit Mishra drank alcohol in law college guard room for hours after crime, say police
content: According to the police, the trio — the other two being Pramit Mukherjee and Zaib Ahmed — then went to a dhaba on EM Bypass for dinner before returning to their respective homes the next morning

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Where police run kangaroo courts
content: The custodial torture and murder of Ajith Kumar, a young security guard at a temple in Sivaganga district, have prompted protests across the State. The sheer brutality of the violence and the deliberate abandonment of due procedure have eroded public faith in the police as custodians of peace and law and order. C. Palanivel Rajan does a deep dive to unravel this horrific, distorted tale

title: Sandeshkhali violence: CBI takes over probe, registers FIR against accused TMC leader Shahjahan Sheikh
content: Justice Joy Sengupta has ordered the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to constitute a special investigation team (SIT) to probe the case with “utmost seriousness”

title: Tension prevails at Ragi Gudda in Shivamogga, following alleged displacement of idols
content: An incident of displacement of Nagara Vigraha (serpent idol) at Bangarappa Layout near Ragi Gudda in Shivamogga Rural Police Station limits occurred

title: M.P.: Culvert collapses on Narsinghpur-Narmadapuram Highway after heavy rainfall
content: The culvert was built over Sukhchain river near Bandesur village in Gadarwara subdivision of Narsinghpur district

title: Water project to benefit parts of Chikkamagaluru, Chitradurga, irks farmers in Davangere
content: The Bhadra Reservoir Project, overall, intends to irrigate over 1.05 lakh hectares spread over Chikkamagaluru, Shivamogga and Davangere districts

title: A.P. govt. pursuing proposal with Centre to set up Mango Board in Chittoor, says official
content: The government will soon release ₹8 crore towards clearing the dues of the pulp processing units, says Principal Secretary for Food Processing

title: Elevated gridlock: Traffic crawls through Gachibowli’s newest flyover
content: Designed as a six-lane elevated corridor linking the Outer Ring Road (ORR) to the city’s IT corridor, the P. Janardhan Reddy (PJR) flyover is seeing daily volumes of up to 75,000 vehicles; this has shifted the pressure onto narrower linking stretches, with bumper-to-bumper traffic stretching onto the flyover

title: India becomes fourth ‘most equal’ country globally
content: India’s Gini Index score stands at 25.5, with only Slovak Republic, Slovenia and Belarus faring better

title: 12-year-old girl gang-raped, murdered in Uttar Pradesh village, four booked
content: The incident has sparked protests, with villagers and leaders of Bhim Army and various other political parties demanding swift action

title: Soaring prices of coconut, coconut oil disrupts budgets of small-time eateries, households
content: Coconut prices cross ₹80 per kg and oil shoots past ₹400 a litre; drop in production, growing global exports, and rising demand for puja and related rituals push rates up

title: PM Modi arrives in Brazil for four-day visit, to attend BRICS Summit
content: In his departure statement, Mr. Modi said that as a founding member of BRICS, India is committed to the bloc as a vital platform for cooperation among emerging economies

title: Call for gender parity in higher judiciary: Women lawyers advocate 50% reservation
content: Senior Advocates of the Karnataka High Court and other members emphasized the urgent need for meaningful representation of women in the judiciary to promote gender equality and justice.

title: July 9 strike against Centre’s policies; for workers and unemployed: Amarjeet Kaur
content: Senior trade union leader says investment is not coming to India because Centre favoured two companies, not because of workers

title: BJP slams Uddhav Thackeray over remarks on Patel community in Gujarat
content: He further accused the BJP of employing similar tactics in Haryana and Maharashtra, alleging that the party incited Jats and Marathas, respectively, to consolidate other communities in its favor.

title: My father Ram Vilas Paswan was a powerful voice of the poor, says Chirag Paswan on birth anniversary
content: The main function was organised in Hajipur, the Lok Sabha seat which Ram Vilas Paswan won eight times; at present, this seat is represented by his son Chirag who garlanded a statue installed near Hajipur Circuit House

title: What are the lessons from Telangana blast? | Explained
content: What are the safety and quality concerns, particularly in smaller pharmaceutical firms? Are regulatory checks not being carried out? What are the protocols to be followed? Are pollution norms being adhered to? How big is the pharma market?

title: Why is Maharashtra debating over Hindi? | Explained
content: Why is there resistance to introducing Hindi as the third language in primary education in government schools? What has the State government decided on the three-language policy? What does the National Education Policy, 2020 lay down?

title: FIR lodged over ‘violations’ during Muharram procession in Srinagar
content: The procession was carried out by Shia Muslims from the city centre Lal Chowk on Friday, July 4, amid tight security; the police did not divulge details about the action for which the FIR was lodged

title: Bhanupali-Bilaspur-Beri railway line project: HC issues notice to Centre, H.P. govt. over fissures in houses
content: Villagers have reported big cracks in their homes due to the construction of the tunnel, which is located just 10 metres from some residences, the petition stated

title: Anti-Hindi war creates a storm in Maharashtra, says CM Stalin
content: CM Stalin stated that the BJP government, which had made teaching Hindi a precondition for allocating funds to Tamil Nadu, backed down after the people of Maharashtra raised their voices against Hindi imposition

title: E-vehicle charging station operators disappointed over revision in electricity fixed charges
content: In the recent tariff order, fixed charges for EV charging stations under LT–VII tariff category in the above 50-112 kW slab have been increased to ₹165 per kW per month when compared to the previous tariff of ₹79 per kW per month

title: Reorganising States into smaller units key to fair delimitation, says expert
content: He highlights the disparity in the value of votes across constituencies, citing a comparison between the Chennai Central and Bangalore North Lok Sabha seats as an example of imbalance

title: Maoists are fighting for rights of the marginalised, says Thirumavalavan
content: On the fourth death anniversary of Father Stan Swamy, a statue in his honour was unveiled at the St. Peter’s Higher Secondary School in his native village of Viragalur

title: Edappadi K. Palaniswami renews call for like-minded parties to join hands against DMK
content: He says the AIADMK will lead the coalition and form the government after it wins the Assembly election in 2026, and that he will be the Chief Ministerial candidate

title: Farming activity gains pace in Cauvery delta for Kuruvai season
content: Comfortable storage in reservoirs has boosted agricultural operations this year; as on Saturday morning, the Mettur dam had 93 tmcft of storage, barely half a tmcft short of its full capacity

title: PM Modi, Argentine President Milei agree to diversify bilateral trade basket
content: In their wide-ranging talks, the two leaders emphasised on boosting defence cooperation between the two countries as it will serve each other's strategic interests.

title: Prove that Forest Rights Act is responsible for ‘negative’ change to forest cover, Tribal Affairs Ministry tells Environment Ministry
content: The Ministry of Tribal Affairs’ communication comes days after over 150 forest rights and civil society groups wrote to the Centre, taking issue with the latest State of Forest Report attribution of “negative” change in forest cover to FRA

title: A.P. CM orders release of water into Jeedipalli reservoir under HNSS Project from July 15
content: Naidu stresses the need to fully utilise the inflows coming through the HNSS and Pothireddypadu system for filling reservoirs across Rayalaseema

title: Over one crore electors submit enumeration forms in Bihar
content: Over 93% forms distributed to voters for electoral roll revision; RJD leader Rabri Devi says Centre and State trying to snatch voting rights, and appeals to people not to show any document except voter ID to visiting polling staff

title: M.P. High Court reverses lower court order that granted ownership of ancestral properties to Saif Ali Khan, family
content: The matter pertains to a ownership dispute among the descendants of the last ruler of the princely state of Bhopal, Nawab Hamidullah Khan

title: Supreme Court notifies quota for OBCs, SCs and STs in direct staff recruitments
content: The Chief Justice of India extends reservation to the physically challenged, ex-servicemen and dependents of freedom fighters

title: Communal tension grips Rajasthan town after man beaten to death
content: A 25-year-old man allegedly beaten to death in a minor road accident after his car hit a vegetable cart in a market, causing a crowd to thrash him

title: Kolkata law student rape case: Classes to resume at Kolkata’s college as probe continues
content: The classes had been suspended after the college campus, particularly the guard room where the incident allegedly unfolded, had been sealed off for the investigation

title: Ganja chocolate smuggler arrested in Vijayawada
content: Accused Subhash Kumar Yadav of Bihar was taking the chocolates to Chennai, say  the Government Railway Police

title: Questions swirl around poll officers’ powers to flag citizenship issues
content: EC guidelines permit electoral registration officers to report suspected foreigner cases to “competent authorities”, while the Citizenship Act, 1955 grants only the Home Ministry the authority to decide on citizenship issues

title: Suvendu urges R.G. Kar victim’s parents to join march against Mamata
content: After the sexual assault of a law college student in Kolkata in June, the BJP leader urged the parents of the R.G. Kar Hospital rape and murder victim to join the march to the State Secretariat on August 9

title: Congress demands special session of Bihar Assembly, claims State is experiencing “goonda raj” under NDA
content: Congress says special session must also discuss the special intensive revision of electoral rolls, terming it a “deliberate conspiracy” to help the BJP win the Assembly election to be held later this year

title: Nipah virus: 425 people under observation as Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode put on high alert
content: In Palakkad, 61 out of 110 people on the contact list are health workers, while in Kozhikode, all 87 are listed as health workers. Health Minister advises psychological assistance for those on the contact list

title: U.P. launches temple renovation and tourism plan to preserve cultural heritage
content: The government says the Tourism Department has prepared a detailed roadmap to transform many sacred sites in eastern U.P. into vibrant centres of heritage tourism. The focus is on bringing lesser-known ancient temples and pilgrimage sites onto the global tourism map, it emphasises

title: Age-old Jain practice of Santhara | Starved for salvation
content: A petition in the Madhya Pradesh High Court seeks a ban on the Jain practice of Santhara for minors after a three-year-old girl diagnosed with brain tumour died in Indore allegedly within half an hour of undertaking a ‘fast-unto-death’. The Hindu reports on the age-old practice and the current debate

title: Delhi High Court quashes 300 Defence Ministry petitions against disability pension to soldiers
content: The Court stresses that disability pension is not an act of generosity but a acknowledgement of the sacrifices soldiers made, which manifest in the form of disabilities/disorders suffered during military service

title: Kaloor stadium to sport a beautified look with fresh coat of paint
content: The beautification work has been progressing since April and is likely to be completed by August. Since its inception, the stadium has been fully painted only once

title: Punjab to impart skill education in business, marketing to school students
content: The State Education Minister Bains says government will provide all technical and financial assistance and that an investment of ₹17 lakh has been made to set up innovation labs

title: CRDA gives its nod for acquiring additional 20,494 acres in Amaravati
content: The meeting has also authorised the CRDA to dredge sand required for constructions in Amaravati from the upstream of Prakasam Barrage on the Krishna for a period of two years

title: Ministers Lokesh, Farook to attend ‘Rottela Panduga’ in Nellore today
content: Around 1,600 policemen deployed, swimmers and boat patrolling arranged at Swarnala Cheruvu, continuous surveillance with 70 CCTV cameras set up for festivities

title: Grama sabha for LPS 2.0: farmers want clarity on status of Amaravati capital, higher compensation
content: They wonder when Amaravati will officially be notified as the capital and who  guarantees its status in case of a change in government after the next elections

title: ‘Mass expulsions in Russian University killed our medical dreams’: Indian students allege ‘financial gain’ by university
content: Russia’s Bashkir State Medical University notice states that foreign students will not be allowed to appear for exams due to “failure to fulfil their obligations to conscientiously master the educational program and complete the curriculum”
